head.s: Interview with Sailesh Gopalan , creator of Brown Paperbag comics

p.s: When did you decide you wanted to write comics ?
Um , I decided around three days before I started making Brown Paperbag [ comics ] .
It was on a complete whim , I just wanted to start , I just wanted to try out something new .
I was reading this webcomic last year in June .

And it is called
Blue Chair
by Shen and I decided , you know , might as well try making my own webcomic and that is actually when I got into it .
Why did you name it " Brown Paperbag " ?

So , brown is a colour we associate with with Indians , and , on top of that , in these old cartoons , people used to put this brown paper bag on the top of their head with two eye holes and that symbolises shame or embarrassment , which is an overarching theme all over my comics .
How much time do you take to write a comic ?
Comic typically takes around three hours .
From idea to the final output .
I have read your comics and most of them are related to satire , but you never entered into politics .

So , the thing is , most of the comics that I have read that are form Indians that are in newspapers are all political and not enough importance has been given to just Indian daily lives , just the families and how they interact with society .

So I have decided to stay away from politics in this comic just because I am not trying to send a message across , I am just trying to appeal to people 's nostalgia , make them remember something that they experienced and just relate to it .
